title: The Meeting
description: Michael sabotages--then promotes--Jim's efforts at getting a promotion, while Dwight and Toby try to prove that Darryl has submitted a fraudulent medical claim.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [knock at Michael's Office door] Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: You wanted to see me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, Oscar come on in.  Close the door if you would.  Thank you, thanks so much for talking to me.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yeah sure.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm going in for a procedure today.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Is everything okay?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, it's routine.  I'm just a little bit scared.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I'm sure everything will be fine.  [pulls up a chair]  What do you? What's the procedure, if you don't mind my asking?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It is a colonoscopy.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: In your experience, what should I be expecting in terms of sensation or emotions? [Oscar looks irritated and frustrated] Is there anything I can do to make it more pleasurable for me or for Dr. Shaundry?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [sighs] Oh my God.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: My main concern, should I have a safe word?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yeah.  [Oscar gets up and walks out]

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: So Michael, do you think you can give me a run down on the Buffalo clients by Monday?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Abso... you know what? I'll do you one better, Sunday, Sunday night.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Okay, I will look at it Monday.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ho, Hol, hold on big guy, I'm gonna put it in the mail Sunday night and you'll get it Weds.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Okay, Jim you wanna hit the conference room?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, Good luck.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh right, this thing. I remember now.  [whispers to Jim]  What's this about?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ah, this is just me and David, if that's okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's okay with me but he's gonna want me in there.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: No, ah it's okay Michael.  We got it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright, do you mind if it sit this out?  I have so much work to do, I feel like I'm gonna blow my brains out.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: [nods] Okay. [Jim smiles and waves to Pam]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Am I worried that Jim and David are having a meeting without me?  No, because we are the Three Amigos.  And once in awhile one of the Amigos will go off... to the bathroom... while the other two have a secret meeting.  [shrugs]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey let me escort you to your desk.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, it's just three or four steps but thank you, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You and Jim are close, huh?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, I think the pregnancy really brought us together.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, what do you think he and David are talking about? What do you...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ummm, I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, you said good luck to Jim as he walked in.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Did I?  Doesn't sound like me, not very superstitious.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: If you are lying to me right now Pam, your baby is gonna come out a liar.  That's how it works.  They inherit things through the breast milk.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Please don't talk about my breast milk.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I just don't want you to lie to me.  I don't want you to ever lie to me.  Have I ever lied to you?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I just don't want you to.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I was rushing to fill an order.  I put the ladder up to grab a box of three hole from the top shelf.  Next thing I know, I'm on the ground and the ladder's on top of me.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: And that's how you broke your ankle?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hmmm, interesting.  How did the ladder end up on top of you, if you fell off of it?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: This doesn't concern you man, you need to walk away.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh really, I'm sorry I thought this was a free country.  I didn't know we were in communist Sweden.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: If we were living in Sweden, I wouldn't have to worry about this 'cause we'd have universal healthcare.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Nnnnn, that's not... okay.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Be quiet.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm talking about... hmmm.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I will send this off to corporate.  Make sure you hold on to your medical bills.  Feel better.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Thanks T-Man, later.  [fist bumps Toby}

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So long Darryl, feel better... [to Toby] He's lying.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: He has a doctor's note.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh? From who, Dr. J?  Look, you really need to investigate this.  People don't just fall off of ladders.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: A guy on my street fell off a ladder painting his house.  It was on the news.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Since when have you known Darryl to rush to do anything other than to come up here for birthday cake?  [imitating Darryl]  Y'all having birthday cake?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: That's not a very good Darryl.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Please... and how many foremen do you know that pull boxes?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Hmmm.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It just doesn't add up.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Well, we did a little investigation and Dwight had a good point.  The ladder didn't reach the top shelf.  I don't know if I believe it, but I am a fan of the hardboiled detective novel.  [impression] I'll punch you in da mush, see.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [walks into conference room on his cell phone, interrupting David and Jim] Uh huh, well if he doesn't like it you can tell that SOB that he is fired.  Sorry, I'm going into a meeting right now.  I will... I love you too.  Bye.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Who was that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sorry about that.  What'd I miss?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Michael, we would like to continue the rest of this meeting in private, please, if you don't mind.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do not mind!  Yes, I do!  No, I don't.  Yes, I do!  No, I don't mind.  Catch you guys on the flippity flop.  Oh this... call waiting.  [answers his phone] Yeah, uh huh,  well you tell the Mayor he just lost six votes.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: [spying on David and Jim] They've been in there a while.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Can't be good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nope.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Think they're talking about me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I think they're talking about me.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Yeah, that makes way more sense.   Okay thanks boss.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What is Jim telling him?  That I can't handle this job?  That 's bull crap.  That is bull crap.  Although, it has been chaotic lately.  Corporate shut down the Buffalo branch which left us to absorb all of their clients.  I will tell you there has been work everyday.  Had to come in on a Saturday. To retrieve... I left my cell phone here.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey Kelly.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Ugh, so jealous of your boobs.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thank you.  Um, listen I just wanted to confirm that you're not coming to the wedding, which is totally understandable and more than fine.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Is Ryan going?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don't know, he hasn't RSVP'd yet.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We invited everyone in the office to our wedding.  Even though we realized most people wouldn't be able to make the drive to Niagara Falls.  [whispers] Which is why we're having it in Niagara Falls.  [normal volume] Then Michael told everyone they could have Friday and Monday  off, if they came.  So now, people have to decide if they want to come to our wedding or have to work.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Here's the deal.  I really want to go but I'm not gonna go if Ryan doesn't go, because it's kind of a waste of time.  That came out wrong.  It would awesome if you could try to get him to go because I'd really like to be there to support Jim.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What can I do for ya Hoss?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [staring into the conference room] How are your sales doin'?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: How are my sales doin'?  Busted.  My numbers are down a little bit and it's 'cause of the economy.  You're not buying it, you're good.  Okay the truth is, I have been having trouble focusing lately.  I'm in this weird, flirty, nebulous thing with this cousin of mine and it's a total mind effer.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Again with the cousin.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, I'm sorry Phyllis, you explain this email, okay.   "Hey Andy let's go visit grandma and then get drunk together, ha ha."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Shhh, I'm just trying to figure out what's going on in that room, okay?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wallace had to show up on the one four month period that I'm completely overwhelmed.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know when they say it's so crazy it just might work?  Well, I don't believe that.  I say go for the air-tight plan and that is why I am having Andy wheel me into the conference room inside a makeshift cheese cart.  It is just elegant.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [in the cheese cart] Be my eyes.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You got it.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: What have we here?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, just backing up and turning around.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hey, we're gonna do this...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Dit, dit, dit, dit, it's not for you. [enters the conference room]  Pardon moi, Messieurs.  I took the liberty of preparing for you a cheese platter which I will place here on the eastern wall of the conference room.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Cheese platter?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oui, Oui, Monsieur.  From the Wisconsin region, a nice firm cheddar.  Also from the great state of Wisconsin, an aged parmesan.  Here you will find a cheddar style spread which has reacted nicely with the air to form a light rind which I think you'll  find both challenging and delicious.  At that point, I would recommend you take a trip south of the border to the great state of Illinois where you will find this fine Bleu Cheese dressing.  If I may be so bold, it's a lot of fun to let the goldfish take a little swim in the bleu cheese.  Bon appetit.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Alright, well I should go.  Thanks for this.  You've given me a lot to think about.  Please promise me you won't do anything until we speak.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, I won't.   Alright, thanks for giving me your time,  I appreciate it.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Thank you Jim.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Erin, is Michael around?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I think he's around here...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [crawls out of the cheese cart unseen] Hey, hey, you must have walked right past me.  How you doin'?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Ah, yeah, could we talk in your office for a second?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, definitely.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: [spying at Darryl's house] Sounds like a EMDP-40.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Nah, that's a GE. A P40 is much higher pitched.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: You're into trains?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I have been my whole life.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm rebuilding a turn of the century steam engine in my slaughter house.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: That's so cool.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Wow, I'd love to take a look at that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, it's just a run of the mill slaughter house, but sure anytime.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Well, you know, 'cause of  the trains.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wa... wa... wait , someone's coming.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Uhh, oh boy, oh boy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Here, get down! He's not using crutches!  Get the camera!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Get over there!  Get over there!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, worker's comp, my ass!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I can't believe this. [mistaking Darryl's sister for Darryl] Hey you, ass****!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Toby...

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: You gonna eat all that dog food yourself?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ooohhh... [crashes car into garbage cans]  Oh man!  You okay?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Just keep going.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey Ryan.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So, I just wanted to confirm that you're not coming to my wedding.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah, I might stop by.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It costs about $75 per person.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Okay, I once had a glass of Cognac that cost $77.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Can you just tell me now if you're coming or not?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yes, I'm coming to your wedding.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, Ryan Howard, yes.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Probably, yes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Kelly Kapoor, yes.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Are you sure you're okay with these new responsibilites?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Look who you're talking to.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: I'm just trying to figure out the best way to utilize everyone's talents.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well I would say that my greatest talent is being the best man, woman, or child, to have ever run this branch, ever.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: What about Jim?  Do you think Jim is someone who is ready to move into a management position?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [looks at Jim]   Permission to speak on the record?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Please do.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jim is like Big Bird.  He is tall and yellow and very nice.  But would I put him in charge?  No, I don't think so.  Because Big Bird doesn't make the tough decisions.  I... If I was gonna put someone in charge, I would put Burt in charge or I would put one of the real grown-ups in charge, like Maria or Gordon, maybe.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: I thought you liked Jim?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Very much, Jim is my best friend. But it's his performance report... right here.  Now this was written by Toby, who we all know is extremely reliable.    				David: [reading performance report]  "Constant office distractions, spends way too much time at reception, antagonizes other salesman, not at all what he thinks he is."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's not very well written, but you get the gist.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Is there anybody else you think could run the day to day of the branch?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I can just continue to run it myself.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Jim had an interesting idea to help you with this extra work load and it involved you being promoted to oversee all northeast sales and then Jim would be promoted to your position.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This was Jim's idea?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Mmhmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow.  Ummm, well I'd have to talk to my mother and my guy at H and R Block.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Ummm... okay, here's the thing though.  The plan doesn't work unless we have someone to replace you.  I was hoping... plus we have to worry about Jim, he has another job offer.  We may have to replace him.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I didn't tell Michael because I thought he'd try to help.  Example, he handed out Jello shots at the 23rd mile of the Steamtown marathon.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Jim can you walk me out to my car for a second.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [after talking to David, Jim looks dejected] I can't help but feel partially responsible.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [shakes jelly beans] Little pick me up?  [Jim accepts] Oh those are the best.  Little sugar rush.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: When you were in the office earlier talking to Wallace, did I come up at all?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well we did talk about how handsome you are.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Why don't we head in your office to talk?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh what a week, God.  We said... I know there were certain things we said...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Michael, look I'll just be honest with you.  Earlier today I spoke with Wallace about a promotion.  I actually think that talk went really well.  And then after he spoke with you, for some reason it felt like things had changed.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hmmm, that's weird, that's weird... it's kinda weirding me out.  Did you know that Lincoln's secretary was named Kennedy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Michael, did you say anything?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Tell you what, when you leave this office I am going to call Wallace and I am going to tell him that you should get that promotion.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You will?  Wanna do it right now?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I tried to keep Michael in the dark.  I should have known that he can do just as much damage in the dark.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I need to see your pupils.   I need to see if they're dilated.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: If they were dilated...

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Toby! Dwight!  Is that them?

quotes.speaker: Gwenneth
quotes.text: Definitely.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You come to my house, bust up my trash cans, call my baby sister an ass****, and told her to eat dog food.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: We thought that she was you.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Why would you think a lady is me?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Are you... are you serious?  Be... cause you look exactly alike.  Am I the only one?  Are you getting this?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: No, nah.  I don't see it.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Here's what I'm gonna do, I'm calling corporate and I'm filing a complaint against both of you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Aww, Darryl.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: C'mon Gwenneth.

quotes.speaker: Gwenneth
quotes.text: Sad.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: [on phone] This is David.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey David, this is Michael Scott.  [Jim pushes speaker phone button]  Michael Scott here.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just wanted to talk to you about  Jim Halpert.  I understand that he did not receive the promotion.  And I wanted to see what I could do to nudge you in the right direction.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: So, what, you're changing your mind about Jim?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Absolutely, [turns speakerphone off] not. [turns speakerphone back on]  Like I said before, Jim is fantastic and he deserves this job.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Michael, it seems like you're cutting in and out... This is not what you said earlier.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wha... here's the thing, Jim is the best man for this job, I think you should give it to him.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Well, it doesn't change what you showed me in Jim's file.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, nnnn, that... that was an anomaly.  That file had been falsified.  Toby Flenderson is doing drugs.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Michael, I really don't know what's going on [police sirens in background] down there, but... oh, dammit, I am getting pulled over for talking on my cell, dammit.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Hey Darryl, look ahhh, we're here to apologize ahh...

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Cool.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wait!  They're using the lift as their own personal elevator.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He broke his ankle climbing over the railing and he lied about it because it was a misuse of company equipment, case closed.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Stupidest thing I've ever heard.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Really?  Then why is there new wood only on one railing?  Hmmm?   We should check the security tapes Toby.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Well, I don't think there's any reason to check 'em but I suppose if we wanted to be really certain...

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Alright, yeah fine so whatever...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: You really did it...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Now, I would like to file an official complaint to corporate because Darryl lied on an official form.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: And I'm telling them you guys sexually harassed my sister.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Phhhht.  No judge is gonna believe that...

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Ahhh, kay.  Look, we could all file complaints against each other and just drown in a sea of paperwork, but you know, we can just move on with our... with our lives.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: So Dwight and Darryl came to an agreement that both would file complaints with corporate and now I get to do all this paperwork.  We worked it out.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, hey Jim, it would make me feel really good right now if you would just punch me in the face.  Alright,  Just do it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: How many times have I asked you to put me up for a branch manager job.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I never recommended you because I didn't want to lose you and I didn't want to lose Pam, [starts to choke up] and now I don't wanna lose the baby.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So instead, you screwed me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's what she...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: David Wallace is calling.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Kind of in the middle of something here.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Should I tell him you'll call him back?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I, yeah... no, I'll tell him myself.  Let's both.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on phone] Hello.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Hey Michael, you got Jim there with you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, it's just us.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Actually, can you call Jim in? I want him on, please.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, oh, well here he is right now.  [Michael knocks on desk]  Come in.  [Makes sound effects for door opening and footsteps and points to Jim to answer]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hi David.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Hey guys, so I spoke to Alan, we had kind of an unconventional idea, which I think is pretty cool.  But it only works if everyone's on board.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well just as long as it means Jim becomes a manager.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: We were thinking of having two branch managers in Scranton.  Both of you guys working as co-managers.  Jim would handle the day to day and Michael you would focus on clients and big picture stuff.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow, that sounds pretty cool.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I like that, so manager and co-manager.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Co-manager and Co-manager.  See, there are a lot of moving pieces and this is the only way I can sell it upstairs.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well that might be a little confusing for people because they know me as manager.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Alright, hey Michael can you pick up for one second.  [Michael picks up phone] Okay look, I'm not going to force you into anything.  If you're willing to lose Jim, fine, you just say so and we'll find another solution, okay.  Is that what you want to do?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay people,  listen up, I have an announcement to make, fraud was committed...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay everybody, I have an announcement to make... whoa do you have an announcement?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm... I was making it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Everybody, David Wallace and I have talked and we have decided to promote Jim to the position of co-manager.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Co-manager of what?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Of your butt, and your butt, and your butt, all of the Scranton branch butts.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: What's happening to you Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What's happening to me?  I am also being promoted to co-manager, we will be co-managers together.  Jim Halpert, welcome.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [shakes Michael's hand] Thank you. [Dwight looks disappointed and angry behind them]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: AHHHHHHHHHHHH!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Niagara Falls in October?  Pfft, hells yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Do you think that you could send in your RSVP card?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Nah, I'll just tell you now, easier.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, you have to choose a food option and there's information in there about directions and lodging...

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I'll just have whatever's fanciest, unless there's ribs.  I'll just get the other information the day of, I'll text you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You are going to text me, the morning of my wedding.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Uh huh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: To ask for directions..

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Right...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And you will eat whatever is fanciest?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Unless there's ribs. [leaves]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Rude.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So rude, right?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Mmm hmmm.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [sits down] Oh my gosh, I have been chasing people down all day.  It's incredible.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Pam, my bag was there...
